title: Preventing Emerging Threats Act of 2018
overview: A bill to assist the Department of Homeland Security in preventing emerging threats from unmanned aircraft and vehicles, and for other purposes.
status: Enacted Via Other Measures Provisions of this bill were incorporated into other bills which were enacted, so there will not likely be further activity on this bill. Provisions of this bill also appear in: H.R. 302: FAA Reauthorization Act of 2018 Enacted — Signed by the President on Oct 5, 2018.
prognosis: 47% chance of being enacted according to Skopos Labs

title: Foreign Investment Risk Review Modernization Act of 2018
overview: Since 1975, the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) has been tasked with ensuring that America’s foreign investments don’t harm its national security. An interagency committee, it’s led by the Treasury Secretary.Although it’s only able to produce recommendations to the president instead of issuing its own policies, presidents of both parties through the decades have often heeded its calls. President Trump blocked a Chinese company’s attempted purchase of an Oregon-based semiconductor company in 2017, and also blocked a Singapore company’s ...
